intro: Volvulus occidentalis var. angustissimus, commonly known as the narrowleaf volvulus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters wide, adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the early summer months. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
